result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.14(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/schooling that is approved by the agent.
Complete a psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations.

No contact with Crystal Vice/Scott or her immediate family, including her children. 
No contact with minors under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety for duration of supervision. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.

Comply with programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections. 
Pay all court ordered financial obligations. 
Sign all release of information forms pertaining to offender's treatment and pharmacies. 
Provide DNA for testing if it has not already been completed.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges are not granted. 
Sentence to commence immediately. 
No credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erik McDonald in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh. Defendant Erik McDonald in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:30 pm. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
No corrections needed.
Atty Cousins indicates victims have been notified and none are present.
Atty Cousins argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney Kavanaugh argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Ct 1:
Sentence Withheld Probation 30 mos
Serve 180 days jail
No credit
No contact with Crystal Vice/ Scott or her immediate family, including her children
No contact with minors under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
Maintain asolute sobriety for duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription
Comply with programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections
Complete a psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations
Pay all court ordered fin obligation
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/schooling that is approved by agent
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances
Sign all release of information forms pertaining to offender's treatment and pharmacies
Provide DNA for testing if it has not already been completed.
Pay DNA surcharge 
Pay costs
Huber privilidges not granted

State indicates DNA was collected.

Court orders Sentence to be served now. Defendant will not be released.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on August 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Erik McDonald in court with attorney Heather B Kavanaugh. Defendant Erik McDonald in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders PSI. 
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Erik McDonald in court with attorney Heather B Kavanaugh. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$5,000 sig bond:  Not to have contact with Unrelated minors,  Crystal Vice and further prior to be being released must comply with sex offender registration.

Attorney  Heather B Kavanaugh appeared by video for Defendant Erik McDonald. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Erik McDonald appeared by video.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: $5,000 sig bond:  Not to have contact with Unrelated minors,  Crystal Vice and further prior to be being released must comply with sex offender registration.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
